title: Particle motion - Velocity from position equation

content.question: A particle moves on the x-axis so that at any time t,0≤t≤1 its position is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>+</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>π</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4A05@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. For what value of t is the particle at rest?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
